keywords.abstract thinking: The ability to understand concepts that are real, such as freedom or vulnerability, but which are not directly tied to concrete physical objects and experiences.
keywords.abstract: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence.
keywords.acheulean toolkit: An archaeological industry of stone tool manufacture characterized by distinctive oval and pear-shaped "hand-axes" associated with Homo erectus.
keywords.adaptation: A change or the process of change by which an organism or species becomes better suited to its environment.
keywords.adaptations: Changes made to survive better in an environment.
keywords.adapted: Changed to survive better in a new environment.
keywords.adapting: Changing to survive better in a new environment.
keywords.analyze: To look at something carefully by breaking it into parts to learn more.
keywords.ancestors: People from whom one is descended.
keywords.anticipate: To expect something that will happen later.
keywords.archaeological: Relating to the study of past human life through old objects.
keywords.archaeologists: Scientists who study past human life by digging up old objects.
keywords.artifacts: Objects made by humans long ago.
keywords.aspirations: Strong hopes or wishes to achieve something.
keywords.australopithecus: An extinct genus of early hominins that lived in Africa between about 4 and 2 million years ago.
keywords.chronic: Lasting a long time or coming back often.
keywords.civilization: An advanced stage of human society with cities, government, and culture.
keywords.complex language: Communication system with intricate grammar, syntax, and vocabulary allowing for detailed expression.
keywords.coordinate: To get people or activities to work together well.
keywords.core: The central or most important part of something.
keywords.culture: The ideas, customs, and social behaviour of a particular people or society.
keywords.denisovans: An extinct species or subspecies of archaic human that ranged across Asia during the Lower and Middle Paleolithic.
keywords.distinguishes: Recognizes or treats (someone or something) as different.
keywords.division of labor: Splitting work into different jobs for different people.
keywords.dna: Deoxyribonucleic acid, a self-replicating material present in nearly all living organisms as the main constituent of chromosomes. It is the carrier of genetic information.
keywords.dwarfism: A condition causing a person or animal to be much smaller than usual.
keywords.energy-demanding: Needing a lot of energy to work or run.
keywords.establish: To set up something that will stay.
keywords.evidence: Facts or signs showing something is true.
keywords.evolution revolution: Term used here to describe the acceleration of change driven by cultural innovations like tool use and fire.
keywords.evolution: The slow process of change in living things over many generations.
keywords.evolutionary: Relating to the process of slow change in living things over time.
keywords.evolve: To change slowly over many lifetimes.
keywords.evolved: To change slowly over many lifetimes.
keywords.experimentation: The process of trying new ideas or methods to see what happens.
keywords.extinct: (of a species, family, or other larger group) having no living members.
keywords.fiber: Thin strings from plants or animals used for cloth or thread.
keywords.figurines: Small statues of people or animals.
keywords.fixed instincts: Automatic, inherited patterns of behavior that are characteristic of a species.
keywords.flourish: To grow well or do well.
keywords.formidable: Causing fear or respect by being very big, strong, or hard.
keywords.fossils: The remains of ancient plants or animals turned into rock.
keywords.fundamentally: In a basic and essential way.
keywords.gene: A tiny part inside living things that carries instructions for how they grow and look.
keywords.genetic: Relating to genes or the instructions passed down from parents.
keywords.hardware: The physical parts of a computer system.
keywords.harnessing: Controlling and using the power of something (like fire or animals).
keywords.harpoons: Plural of harpoon; spear-like tools for catching fish or large sea animals.
keywords.hominins: Early human-like creatures that walked upright, including our direct ancestors.
keywords.homo erectus: An extinct species of archaic human from the Pleistocene, with its earliest occurrence about 1.9 million years ago.
keywords.homo floresiensis: An extinct species of small archaic human that inhabited the island of Flores, Indonesia, until the arrival of modern humans about 50,000 years ago.
keywords.homo habilis: An extinct species of archaic human from the Early Pleistocene of East Africa, dated to about 2.8 to 1.5 million years ago.
keywords.homo heidelbergensis: An extinct species or subspecies of archaic human which existed during the Middle Pleistocene.
keywords.identity: Who or what a person or group is; the qualities that make them unique.
keywords.identities: Plural of identity; the qualities that make different people or groups who they are.
keywords.innovative: Using new ideas or methods; creative and original.
keywords.intricately: In a very complicated or detailed manner.
keywords.inventors: People who create new things for the first time.
keywords.legacy: Something left behind or passed down by people from the past.
keywords.manipulations: Skillful handling or controlling of things, especially with the hands.
keywords.marrow: The soft, fatty substance inside bones, often rich in nutrients.
keywords.mental mapping: Creating a picture in your mind of a place or area to navigate it.
keywords.migration: Movement from one part of something to another.
keywords.minimal: The smallest amount possible or necessary.
keywords.mousterian toolkit: A style of predominantly flint tools (or industry) associated primarily with Neanderthals.
keywords.mutation: A small, random change that happens in the instructions (DNA) of living things.
keywords.mutations: Small, random changes that happen in the instructions (DNA) of living things.
keywords.natural selection: The process whereby organisms better adapted to their environment tend to survive and produce more offspring.
keywords.neanderthalensis: An extinct species or subspecies of archaic human who lived in Eurasia until about 40,000 years ago.
keywords.neanderthals: An extinct species or subspecies of archaic human who lived in Eurasia until about 40,000 years ago.
keywords.neurologically: In a way that relates to the brain, nerves, and nervous system.
keywords.nomadic: Moving from place to place regularly, often following food sources, instead of living in one spot.
keywords.oldowan tools: The earliest widespread stone tool archaeological industry (style) in prehistory.
keywords.organism: Any single living thing, like a plant, animal, or bacteria.
keywords.passively: Without taking active action; letting things happen without trying to change them.
keywords.persevere: To keep going and not give up, even when things are difficult.
keywords.pigment: A natural substance that gives color to things like paint, skin, or plants.
keywords.pigments: Natural substances that gives color to things like paint, skin, or plants.
keywords.populations: Groups of people or animals of the same kind living in a certain area.
keywords.pre-digested: Already partly broken down before being eaten, making it easier for the body to use (like cooked food).
keywords.pre-installed: Put in or set up ahead of time (like basic programs on a computer or instincts in an animal).
keywords.pre-shaped: Formed into a particular shape before being used or finished.
keywords.precision: Being very exact and accurate in movement or detail.
keywords.predators: Animals that naturally prey on others.
keywords.predetermined: Decided or set up in advance, not based on choice or chance at the time.
keywords.prehistoric: Relating to or denoting the period before written records.
keywords.preserved: Kept safe from harm or decay over a long time.
keywords.preserving: Keeping something in its original state or safe from harm.
keywords.programmed: Given a set of instructions to follow automatically.
keywords.revolutionary: Involving or causing a complete or dramatic change.
keywords.self-programmers: Beings (like humans) who can learn and create their own ways of thinking and acting, rather than just following built-in instincts.
keywords.semi-underground: Partly below the surface of the ground.
keywords.serrated: Having a jagged edge like a saw blade, good for cutting or sawing.
keywords.social intelligence: The ability to understand and navigate complex social relationships and dynamics.
keywords.software: Programs and instructions that tell a computer or system what to do (used metaphorically for learned behaviors/culture).
keywords.sophisticated: Advanced, complex, clever, or having a deep understanding.
keywords.spear-throwers: Tools (like an atlatl) used to throw spears farther and with more force.
keywords.specialized: Requiring or involving detailed and specific knowledge or training.
keywords.species: A group of similar living things that can breed together and produce offspring.
keywords.survival of the fittest: Phrase that originated from evolutionary theory as a way of describing the mechanism of natural selection.
keywords.symbolic thought: The capacity to use symbols (like words, images, or gestures) to represent objects, events, or ideas.
keywords.symmetry: When both sides of something are matching or balanced.
keywords.tanning: The process of treating animal skins with chemicals or natural substances to turn them into durable leather.
keywords.technique: A specific, skilled way of doing something.
keywords.trait: A specific feature or quality that makes someone or something different (like eye color or height).
keywords.transform: To change completely in form, appearance, or character.
keywords.transforming: In the process of changing something completely.
keywords.trauma: A serious physical injury or a deeply upsetting emotional experience.
keywords.upgrade: An improvement that makes something better, newer, or more effective.
keywords.vital: Absolutely necessary or essential for life or success.
keywords.volcanic: Relating to, produced by, or characteristic of a volcano.
